intro: Glyptopetalum longipedicellatum, commonly known as the long-stalked starflower, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in early summer. Due to its limited distribution and sensitivity to environmental changes, it is considered a vulnerable species.
